To use your fingerprint to unlock your screen or confirm purchases, you’ll need to:
Set up your backup screen lock method
Just touch the fingerprint sensor to unlock your phone, authorize purchases, or sign in to apps. Be careful whose fingerprints you add - any fingerprints added will be able to do these things.
Note: Your fingerprint may be less secure than a strong pattern or digital password.
Locate the fingerprint sensor on the back of your phone.
Illustration with device and fingerprint sensor location
Put your finger on the sensor and lift after you feel a vibration
Move your finger slightly to add all the different parts of your fingerprint
Whenever you see this icon, you can use your fingerprint for identification or to authorize a purchase.
Just touch the fingerprint sensor to wake and unlock your device.
When you see this icon, you can use your fingerprint.
You’ve chosen to use your fingerprint as one way to unlock your phone. If you skip now, you’ll need to set this up later. Setup takes only a minute or so.
Use the fingerprint sensor on your device.
Fingerprint enrollment time limit reached. Try again.
"Fingerprint enrollment didn't work. Try again or use a different finger."
In addition to unlocking your phone, you can also use your fingerprint to authorize purchases and app access. Learn more
Screen lock option disabled. You can still use your fingerprint to authorize purchases and app access. Learn more
Lift finger, then touch sensor again
You can add up to %d fingerprints
"You won't be able to use your fingerprints to unlock your phone, authorize purchases, or sign in to apps with them."

"You can encrypt your accounts, settings, downloaded apps and their data, media, and other files. After you encrypt your phone, assuming you’ve set up a screen lock (that is, a pattern or numeric digital password or mixed password), you’ll need to unlock the screen to decrypt the phone every time you power it on. The only other way to decrypt is to perform a factory data reset, erasing all your data.
Encryption takes an hour or more. You must start with a charged battery and keep your phone plugged in throughout the process. If you interrupt it, you’ll lose some or all of your data."
Charge your battery and try again.
Plug in your charger and try again.
No lock screen digital password or mixed password
You need to set a lock screen digital password or mixed password before you can start encryption.
The encryption operation is irreversible and if you interrupt it, you’ll lose data. Encryption takes an hour or more, during which the phone will restart several times.
Wait while your phone is being encrypted. ^1% complete.
Wait while your phone is being encrypted. Time remaining: ^1
To unlock your phone, turn it off and then on.
Warning: Your device will be wiped after ^1 more failed attempts to be unlocked!

"Encryption was interrupted and can’t complete. As a result, the data on your phone is no longer accessible.
To resume using your phone, you need to perform a factory reset. When you set up your phone after the reset, you’ll have an opportunity to restore any data that was backed up to your Google Account."

"The password you entered is correct, but unfortunately your data is corrupt.
To resume using your phone, you need to perform a factory reset. When you set up your phone after the reset, you’ll have an opportunity to restore any data that was backed up to your Google Account."
Choose your backup screen lock method
Change or disable pattern, digital password, or mixed password security
Choose a method to lock the screen
Disabled by administrator, encryption policy, or credential storage
Once you’ve set up a screen lock, you can also set up your fingerprint in Settings > Security.
Device protection features will not work without your pattern.

"Device protection features will not work without your pattern.
Your saved fingerprints will also be removed from this device and you won't be able to unlock your phone, authorize purchases, or sign in to apps with them."
Device protection features will not work without your digital password.

"Device protection features will not work without your digital password.
Your saved fingerprints will also be removed from this device and you won't be able to unlock your phone, authorize purchases, or sign in to apps with them."
Device protection features will not work without your mixed password.

"Device protection features will not work without your mixed password.
Your saved fingerprints will also be removed from this device and you won't be able to unlock your phone, authorize purchases, or sign in to apps with them."
Device protection features will not work without your screen lock.

"Device protection features will not work without your screen lock.
Your saved fingerprints will also be removed from this device and you won't be able to unlock your phone, authorize purchases, or sign in to apps with them."

digital password must be fewer than %d digits.

"When this feature is turned on, you can beam app content to another NFC-capable device by holding the devices close together. For example, you can beam Browser pages, YouTube videos, People contacts, and more.
Just bring the devices together (typically back to back) and then touch your screen. The app determines what gets beamed."

Enter pin %1$s on your WLAN router. The setup can take up to two minutes to complete.

"Back up photos & other media" Move your media files to alternative storage on this device, or transfer them to a computer using a USB cable.
"Back up apps" All apps stored on this ^1 will be uninstalled and their data will be erased. To keep these apps, move them to alternative storage on this device."

When you eject this ^1, apps stored on it will stop working, and media files stored on it will not be available until it is reinserted."
This ^1 is formatted to work on this device only. It won’t work on any others."

"To use the apps, photos, or data this ^1 contains, reinsert it.
Alternatively, you can choose to forget this storage if the device isn’t available.
If you choose to forget, all the data the device contains will be lost forever.
You can reinstall the apps later, but their data stored on this device will be lost."
All the apps, photos, and data stored on this ^1 will be lost forever.

"When this feature is turned on, you can zoom in and out by triple-tapping the screen.
While zoomed in, you can: "
"Pan: Drag two or more fingers across the screen. "
Adjust zoom level: Pinch two or more fingers together or spread them apart."
You can also temporarily magnify what’s under your finger by triple-tapping and holding. In this magnified state, you can drag your finger to explore different parts of the screen. Lift your finger to return to your previous state.
Note: Triple-tap for magnification works everywhere except the keyboard and navigation bar."

"When this feature is turned on, you can quickly enable accessibility features in two steps:
Step 1: Press and hold the power button until you hear a sound or feel a vibration.
Step 2: Touch and hold two fingers until you hear audio confirmation.
If the device has multiple users, using this shortcut on the lock screen temporarily enables accessibility until the device is unlocked."
Update screen magnification on app transitions
This feature is experimental and may affect performance.

"Automatically back up device data (such as Wi-Fi passwords and call history) and app data (such as settings and files stored by apps) remotely.
When you turn on automatic backup, device and app data is periodically saved remotely. App data can be any data that an app has saved (based on developer settings), including potentially sensitive data such as contacts, messages, and photos."

WLAN hotspot can share this phone’s data Internet connection with other PC/mobile devices via WLAN.
After the WLAN hotspot is turned on, other PC/mobile devices can connect to it and start using the internet by following steps:
1. Turn on WLAN on PC/Mobile device.
2. Find “%s” in the list of WLAN networks.
3. Select “%s” and Enter ”%s” in the password field.
4. Start using the Internet on PC/Mobile device.
To use WLAN hotspot, turn it on.
Your HotSpot is not visible now

If you switch the Broadcast Network Name (SSID) option off, your phone will not be visible to other devices and will not appear in the list of available Wi-Fi networks. Other devices can still connect to your HotSpot by entering its network name manually.

You can add it later through MyAccount applic ation on your phone or online at https://my.t-mobile.com under Manage > Plans and Services.

"You can tether your Android device to your computer with a USB cable, to share your device's Internet connection with your computer.
1. USB tethering works with Windows Vista, Windows 7, and Linux, the USB drivers for tethering may be needed.
2. If your device has an SD card or USB storage, you can't mount it on your computer when USB tethered"

"You can turn your Android device into a portable Wi-Fi hotspot, to share your Android device's Internet connection with one or more computers or other devices.
1.When your device is serving as a Wi-Fi hotspot, you can not use your device's applications to access the Internet via its Wi-Fi connection (but of course you remain connected to the Internet via your mobile data network).
2.You configure the hotspot with the Wi-Fi hotspot settings"

USB tethering" You can tether your Android device to your computer with a USB cable, to share your device's Internet connection with your computer.
1.USB tethering works with Windows Vista, Windows 7, Windows 8, Windows 8.1 and Linux.
2.If your device has an SD card or USB storage, you can't mount it on your computer when USB tethered.
"Portable Wi-Fi hotspot" You can turn your Android device into a portable Wi-Fi hotspot, to share your Android device's Internet connection with one or more computers or other devices.
1.When your device is serving as a Wi-Fi hotspot, you can't use your device's applications to access the Internet via its Wi-Fi connection (but of course you remain connected to the Internet via your mobile data network).
2.You configure the hotspot with the Wi-Fi hotspot settings."
With Open security, any device can connect to your Mobile HotSpot and use your mobile data connection.

Wi-Fi Calling lets you make and receive voice calls and text/multimedia messages over Wi-Fi when your phone is connected to a Wi-Fi network and registered with the MetroPCS network for Wi-Fi Calling.
To enable Wi-Fi,use the wireless control section of your Android settings menu.
How do I enable Wi-Fi Calling?
Be default, your phone is enabled for Wi-Fi Calling as soon as you enable the Wi-Fi radio. Wi-Fi Calling can be controlled from the Wi-Fi Calling Settings.
How do I know when I am using Wi-Fi for my calls?

When your phone associates with a Wi-Fi network,it will automatically try to register with the MetroPCS network for Wi-Fi Calling. Once the registration has successfully completed you will see the Wi-Fi Calling icon in the Status Bar.You will also see the Wi-Fi Calling icon displayed in the dialer(in place of your regular calling icon) and you will briefly see a message at the top of the screen saying,Calls will be made over Wi-Fi.
Will calls or SMS/MMS over Wi-Fi be charged differently than my cellular calls?
The primary benefit of Wi-Fi Calling is to increase your coverage in locations with Wi-Fi.Calls and messages made over Wi-Fi will be charged like cellular calls for certain plans.
What happens if I lose Wi-Fi coverage?

When the handset loses Wi-Fi coverage,any active calls will drop and the phone will connect to the cellular network if possible. You will receive a prompt if your call drops due to a loss of Wi-Fi coverage.

This function aims to cast the picture and video files in the mobile device to the TV and play on the TV screen
Dongle: the dongle must be compatible with TCL v102,China Mobile WiMo and NETGEAR ptv3000
The above-mentioned dongles have been validated compatibility
LCD TV: the TV must be compatible with HDMI port
Before using this function, WLAN must be activated. Then open Screen mirroring application and toggle the switch on
Configure TV device and dongle（take the v102 dongle and SONY TV as example)
Take the v102 dongle and SONY TV as example
1.Charge the dongle with its own charger or connect it to the USB port in the TV
2.Connect the dongle HDMI with the TV HDMI
3.Switch the output mode of TV to HDMI input (The output of HDMI must be similar to the input HDMI). The TV will show the dongle screen
Open the TV LINK APP and search for the dongle. After locate the dongle, click connect. And then the TV will show the mobile device screen(Activate screen switch to display full screen)
Activate screen switch to display full screen

\u0009This function has not passed the Certification of Wi-Fi Alliance. If dongle is not compatible with abovementioned conditions, a match can not be guaranteed. Interfering Wi-Fi connections in a wide spread area can make it more difficult to find a match due to interference with each other.
